alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:42PM CST until February 05 at 9:49PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... White River from Edwardsport to Hazleton Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton East Fork White River at Seymour. Tippecanoe River near Delphi. Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is potential for flooding to develop later in the week at Vincennes and Mount Carmel. The crest is past Lafayette and should reach Covington by mid-morning Monday. The rives are rising at all locations. Flooding may last as long as Tuesday, February 6. Lowland flooding is either expected to develop or may develop on the lower White River by Monday night from about Edwardsport downstream to the Hazleton area. Flooding could last as long as Wednesday afternoon. Additional flooding is ongoing on the East Fork White at Seymour and tributaries of the upper Wabash. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, FEBRUARY 05... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Terre Haute. * WHEN...Until Monday, February 05. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Pottsville Street just northwest of Terre Haute is flooded. Lowland flooding in progress with several river roads flooded in Clark County Illinois. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Sunday /7:30 PM CST Sunday/ the stage was 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Sunday /7:30 PM CST Sunday/ was 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.2 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, February 05. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 1245 PM EST /1145 AM CST/.
